title: What It Takes to Become a Great Product Manager
excerpt: For an aspiring product manager (PM), there are three primary considerations when evaluating the role: core competencies, emotional intelligence (EQ), and company fit. The best PMs have mastered the core competencies, have a high EQ, and work for the right company for them. The last requires thinking about the level of technical skill the company requires, its philosophy of the PM role, the stage of the company, and the relationship you’ll have with senior management.
